forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. North northeast wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog between 8am and 10am. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. North wind around 7 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the evening air carries a gentle chill, wrapping the city in a soft embrace. The forecast predicts a low around 47 degrees, hinting at the crispness of the night. The skyline, punctuated by the twinkling lights of the urban landscape, suggests a patchy fog creeping in from the bay, cloaking parts of the city but leaving enough clarity to appreciate the silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance. The serene north-northeast breeze, whispering at around 6 mph, adds to the peaceful ambiance, a reminder of winter’s gentle descent.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, early risers may encounter fog between 8 and 10 a.m., a hint of mystery over the streets before the sun breaks through to reveal a partly sunny day. Highs will flirt with 58 degrees, before descending to 55 in the afternoon, inviting locals to don layers that can easily transition from the cool morning air to the mild afternoon warmth. Perhaps it’s a perfect moment to wrap yourself in a cozy sweater and stroll along the Embarcadero, or to enjoy a warm cup of coffee while gazing at the dynamic interplay of light and shadow that characterizes this vibrant city. As the fog rolls in and out like a whispered secret, San Francisco’s charm remains ever-present, inviting quiet moments of reflection amid its bustling charm.
